page.title: 03Local History
page.content: When the Romans came over to England they split the country into{three main {areas.}These were{Northumbria, {Mercia and Wessex.}Our D-Block is just on the border splitting Northumbria from Mercia.Most of the villages in our area got their names in{Anglo {Saxon times.}Many places have names ending in{"ton".}This stands for,"The settlement of------".For example, {Anston,Laughton and Dinnington. Other places end in{"well"},meaning a settlement near water.If we split our D_Block into smaller areas we can find out a great deal about its local {history.}Anston use to be{farm land with a{quarry.}They used some of the quarry stone to{rebuild}part of the {Houses Of Parliament}after it was {demolished by salt}from the{Thames}in the 1840's.
